com.dsp

Class DspOpen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dsp.DspOpen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DspObject

    public class DspOpen
extends java.lang.Object
implements DspObject

    Manager of all open statements. Each statament that opens multiple rows is stored as in a stack arrangement, with the most recently added being the first found. Statements will have a unique name assigned to them, if the programmer does not assign one using the #name syntax. Statements can be found in this object by using their name.

    This also keeps a cache of connections used during the request so DSP can reuse the same connections. This is a requirement for handling database transactions. Connections are freed once the request has completed.

    • Method Detail

      • abortAll

        public void abortAll()
        Closes all open statements, and rolls back all uncommitted transactions. Use when forwarding to an error handling page. Used by release().

      • exists

        public boolean exists(java.lang.String name)
        Returns true if the object (statament name) exists.

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the named object (Statement) or null if not found. Statement names are search in reverse order of their opening, like a Stack.
        Specified by:
        get in interface DspObject

      • getConnection

        public Connect getConnection()
        Returns the current connection.

      • getConnection

        public Connect getConnection(java.lang.String name)
                      throws DspException
        Returns the connection associated with name. If none is found in the list of used connections then the group is searched for the database and a new connection is checked out. This does not modify the current stored connection in this object.
        Throws:
        DspException

      • getConnection

        public Connect getConnection(Database db)
                      throws DspException
        Returns the connection associated with the database. If none is found in the list of used connections then a new connection is checked out. This does not modify the current stored connection in this object.
        Throws:
        DspException

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases this object, to make it available to another thread. It will close all open statements and rollback all uncommitted transactions.

      • unset

        public void unset(java.lang.String variable)
           throws DspException
        Unset (remove) a member's value. This only works with debugMode and traceMode, since other memebers are removed when the statement is closed, usually when an else or end command is executed.
        Specified by:

        Throws:
